::: {.Exercise data-latex=""}

Calculez la solubilit√© de $\ce{Mg(OH)2}$ dans $\ce{MgCl2}$ 0.10 M. ($K_{ps} = 5.61 \cdot 10^{-12}$)

\vspace{\stretch{1}}

:::

::: {.Answer data-latex=""}

\begin{tabular}{ cccccc } 
~ & \ce{Mg(OH)2(s)} & \ce{<=>} & \ce{Mg^{2+}(aq)} & + & 2\ \ce{OH^{-}(aq)} \\
\midrule
init. & & & 0.1 & & 0 \\
\midrule
$\Delta$ & & & +s & & +2s \\
\midrule
final & & & 0.1+s & & 2s \\
\midrule
\end{tabular}

$$
\begin{split}
  K_{ps} = |\ce{Mg^{2+}}| \cdot |\ce{OH^{-}}|^2 &= (0.1+s) \cdot (2s)^2 \\
  &= (0.1+\cancel{s}) \cdot (2s)^2 \\
  K_{ps} &= 0.4s^2
\end{split}
\qquad\qquad
\begin{split}
  \Rightarrow\ s &= \sqrt[2]{\frac{K_{ps}}{0.4}} = \sqrt[2]{\frac{1.8 \cdot 10^{-11}}{0.4}} \\  &= 6.71 \cdot 10^{-6}{\ [mol/L]}
\end{split}
$$

:::
